parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.DenormalizedExample.TEMP_VSORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record the vital sign result.
fields.definition: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: N/A
fields.label: Temperature
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". In addition to the SDTMIG variable VSORRES, create VSTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of VSTEST from VSTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the VSTEST.
fields.name: TEMP_VSORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the temperature measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.DenormalizedExample.TEMP_VSORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.
fields.label: Temperature Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: TEMP_VSORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the temperature measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.DenormalizedExample.TEMP_VSCLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the temperature result was clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether the temperature result was clinically significant.
fields.implementationNotes: N/A
fields.label: Temperature Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM = "VSCLSIG" and SUPPVS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: TEMP_VSCLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the temperature result clinically significant?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78431

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.DenormalizedExample.SYSBP_VSPOS

self.title: Systolic Blood Pressure Position of Subject

fields.completionInstructions: Record the position of subject at time of test (e.g. SITTING).
fields.definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSPOS may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF if needed.
fields.label: Systolic Blood Pressure Position of Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SYSBP_VSPOS
fields.questionText: What was the position of the subject during the systolic blood pressure measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.DenormalizedExample.SYSBP_VSLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not pre-printed on CRF.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of vital signs measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Example: ARM for blood pressure. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Systolic Blood Pressure Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SYSBP_VSLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the systolic blood pressure measurement was taken?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.DenormalizedExample.SYSBP_VSLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the systolic blood pressure measurement.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: Laterality is collected for each test on the horizontal record. May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Systolic Blood Pressure Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SYSBP_VSLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the systolic blood pressure measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
